name: ifnefalse
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3
body: |- wi(wne(c0, c1), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wceq(c0, c1)), c3))

stmt.origin: sylbi(wne(c0, c1), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wceq(c0, c1)), c3), wn(wceq(c0, c1)))
stmt.pretty: sylbi(c0 ≠ c1, if(c0 = c1, c2, c3)= c3, ¬ c0 = c1)

body.origin:
|- wi(wne(c0, c1), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wceq(c0, c1)), c3))
-| wb(wne(c0, c1), wn(wceq(c0, c1)))
-| wi(wn(wceq(c0, c1)), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wceq(c0, c1)), c3))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wne(c0, c1), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wceq(c0, c1)), c3))
-| wb(wne(c0, c1), wn(wceq(c0, c1)))
-| wi(wn(wceq(c0, c1)), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wceq(c0, c1)), c3))

|- wi(wne(c0, c1), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wceq(c0, c1)), c3))
-| wi(wn(wceq(c0, c1)), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wceq(c0, c1)), c3))

body.origin: |- wi(wn(wceq(c0, c1)), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wceq(c0, c1)), c3))

cumulated.origin: |- wi(wne(c0, c1), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wceq(c0, c1)), c3))

comment: When values are unequal, but an "if" condition checks if they are equal, then the "false" branch results. This is a simple utility to provide a slight shortening and simplification of proofs versus applying ~ iffalse directly in this case. It happens, e.g., in ~ oevn0 . (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 15-May-2015.)
